TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively . The first applicant lives in GPE , GPE and the second applicant in GPE , GPE . The third applicant is the estate ( kuolinpesä , dödsbo ) of the late PERSON , represented by the first applicant . The applicants are represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE PERSON inherited property – ORG RN : o DATE ( “ ORG property ” ) at ORG in the municipality of GPE ( which , since DATE is the “ city of GPE ) . Since her death on DATE , the property has been part of her estate and has belonged to her beneficiaries , the first and second applicants . The property has a surface area of QUANTITY and is undeveloped . It is situated near the central park of GPE .

In DATE ORG ( kauppalanvaltuusto , köpingsfullmäktige , now ORG ( kaupunginvaltuusto , stadsfullmäktige ) ) , adopted a municipal building plan ( rakennussuunnitelma , byggnadsplan ; called as rakennuskaava FAC ( rakennuslaki , byggnadslagen ; Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) ) for the locality , including the ORG property . The plan was approved by ORG ( lääninhallitus , länsstyrelsen ) on DATE . The plan assigned potential floor space of QUANTITY on the ORG property .

On DATE ORG ordered that no new building could be constructed in that area without its permission until adequate water , sewerage and traffic facilities had been provided ( ban on building ( rakennuskielto , byggnadsförbud ) ) . ORG ( sisäasiainministeriö , inrikesministeriet ) upheld that decision on DATE .

On DATE ORG decided that a wider area should be incorporated within a town plan ( asemakaava , stadsplan ) and renewed the ban on building . On DATE ORG decided that a town plan would be prepared for the NORP and surrounding areas and imposed a new ban on building .

On DATE ORG annulled the municipal building plan , because a more extensive town plan was to be drawn up . A ban on building was imposed pursuant to section ORG ) of LAW . The decision was approved by ORG on DATE . The ban on building was renewed CARDINAL times , so that it remained in force for DATE , until DATE . It would appear that in DATE and possibly in DATE the applicants ( or their relatives ) unsuccessfully appealed to ORG against the renewals of the ban on building .

In DATE a programme to draw up a master plan ( yleiskaava , generalplan ) was adopted . A regional development plan ( seutukaava , regionplan ) was adopted in DATE under the terms of which , according to the Government , the ORG property became part of a larger recreation zone . The applicants maintained that the ORG property was marked with a symbol denoting an area of dense population . In DATE a proposal for a component master plan ( osayleiskaava , delgeneralplan ) was made in respect of a northern section of GPE . Under this proposal the southern part of the applicants’ property would have been used for detached housing .

During DATE the applicants negotiated with the city of GPE for a possible land - exchange contract . A letter of intent was signed in DATE and was stated to be valid for DATE . As no town plan was adopted , the letter of intent lapsed in DATE .

On DATE ORG ( kaupunginhallitus , stadssyrelsen ) prolonged the ban on building on the ORG property for the fifteenth time on the ground that a town plan was due to be drawn up for the area . The applicants appealed to ORG ( ympäristöministeriö , miljöministeriet ; Ministry ) . They submitted that the ban on building , which had applied to the ORG property for DATE , could not be regarded as temporary within the meaning of the existing legislation and was unconstitutional . They also asked the Ministry to request the competent municipal authority to draw up a master plan and a town plan for the area in question .

At the request of the building board ( rakennuslautakunta , byggnadsnämnden ) , ORG decided to remove the detached housing zone from the proposal for a component master plan in a decision of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the Ministry partially lifted the ban on building in the area . However , in spite of the applicants’ appeal the ban on building in respect of the ORG property remained in force . The ORG stated that , as the town plan concerning the area was included in the planning programme of the city of GPE and the ORG property was located near the central park , the planning arrangements in respect of that area of land had to be decided in a town plan . By a separate decision of DATE , it rejected an application by the applicants for the city of GPE to be required to adopt a detailed plan . The applicants appealed to ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) against these CARDINAL decisions .
Meanwhile , the ban on building was extended ( for DATE ) until DATE by a decision of ORG on DATE .

In DATE a planning programme for DATE was adopted . The planning area “ LOC CARDINAL ” , covering the ORG property , was included in the programme , but without any detailed time - table specifying when it would be subject to a further plan .

On DATE ORG adopted part I of the master plan ( yleiskaavan osa I , generalplan del I ) for the north of GPE . The ORG property was now designated for recreational use . The ORG dismissed the appeals and approved the plan on DATE . ORG rejected the ORG appeal on DATE .

Meanwhile , on DATE ORG gave its decision on DATE ) ban on building that had been issued by ORG on DATE and approved by ORG . The court ruled , inter alia , that the city had not started to draw up a town plan , and that , taking into account the planned use of the land and the length of the ban on building , there had been no special reasons to renew it . However , as the ban had expired at DATE , it did not rule further on the case . The decision became a precedent ( ORG DATE A CARDINAL ) .
On DATE ORG dismissed the ORG appeal concerning the obligation to adopt a detailed plan . It found that there were no legal grounds under which the ORG could oblige the city to draw up such a plan .

ORG approved LOC I component master plan for a northern section of GPE on DATE . The decision was approved by ORG on DATE and upheld by ORG on DATE . This plan covered a small southern part of the applicants’ property , which was assigned partly to a neighbourhood recreational zone and partly to a conservation zone ( the ORG hazel grove ) .

In DATE , basing their application on ORG decision of DATE , the applicants applied for an exemption permit in order to build CARDINAL terraced houses and CARDINAL detached houses , comprising of QUANTITY in total , despite the lack of any town plan . Their application was rejected on DATE by ORG , which found as follows :

“ In the regional development plan of DATE the [ ORG ] property was assigned to a recreational zone . Since then CARDINAL master plans covering the area in question have been adopted , namely part I of the master plan for the north of GPE and LOC I master plan . These plans designate the bulk of the property for recreational use , outdoor activities and sports . The property is crossed by important recreational routes leading from the central park to the north . The Vassberget area is situated in the south - east section of the property , which is reserved for use as a conservation zone in part I of the master plan for the north of GPE , and in the southern part of the property there is the PERSON area , which is reserved for conservation in LOC I master plan .

Before a decision can be taken on whether the applicants’ property can be built on ... both a master plan and a town plan have to be drawn up for the area , and this involves also an examination of the need for recreational zones , the connections to the central park , and the suitability of the property for building purposes . A building project on this scale can not be based on an exemption permit . ”

The applicants appealed to ORG , claiming , inter alia , that the refusal to grant them an exemption allowing them to build and the lack of a detailed plan had de facto denied them the right to peacefully enjoy their property for DATE without compensation .
On DATE ORG dismissed their appeal .

On DATE , upon the applicants’ application , ORG ( oikaisulautakunta , rättelsenämnden ) of ORG ( verotoimisto , skattebyrå ) changed the rateable value of their property for DATE to correspond to the planning situation ( use of the land for recreational and outdoor activities ) and the liability to rates on the value of the building was cancelled .

LAW ( Suomen Hallitusmuoto , ORG ; Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , which was in force until DATE , provided that the right of NORP citizens to their possessions was to be secured by law ( section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) ) . Since DATE property has been protected by LAW no . CARDINAL ) . This provision is equivalent to LAW of the present LAW ( perustuslaki , grundlagen ; Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .

Section CARDINAL ) of LAW , as worded at the relevant time , provided that urban development ( taaja - asutus , tätbebyggelse ) was permitted only in areas with a ratified town plan , municipal building plan or shore plan ( rantakaava , strandplan ) . According to subsection CARDINAL , exemptions could be granted in individual cases or in certain areas .

Section PERSON ) of LAW required the authorities to ensure that planning measures would not hinder the implementation of the regional development plan . Under section CARDINAL the authorities had to ensure that new construction would not hinder the use of land as contemplated in the regional development plan ( a building restriction ( rakentamisrajoitus , byggnadsinkränkning ) ) .

Section CARDINAL prohibited the construction of new buildings if it contravened a town plan ( a building restriction ) . Subsection CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) imposed a ban on building in areas for which a town plan was scheduled to be drawn up .

By virtue of section DATE , subsection CARDINAL the ban on building was valid for a maximum of DATE . However , if special reasons so warranted , it could be extended for a maximum of DATE at a time . The legislation in force at the relevant time did not include any specific provisions on the maximum duration of bans on building . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) provided , however , that the competent ministry could set a time - limit by which the municipal authorities had to make a decision on a town plan .

Under section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , of ORG ja rakennuslaki , markanvändnings- och bygglag ; Act no . CARDINAL ) , which repealed LAW with effect from DATE , a ban on building is valid for a maximum of DATE . While the plan remains incomplete , the municipality may extend the term for a maximum of DATE at a time . However , under the new legislation , a ban on building may not exceed DATE in all .

According to section CARDINAL of LAW , as worded at the relevant time , the Ministry had power to grant exemptions from provisions , orders , prohibitions or other restrictions concerning construction ( such as prohibitions against urban development ) laid down in LAW or adopted by virtue of it , if an exemption would not substantially impede the implementation of planning or other housing arrangements or the achievement of nature conservation objectives .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the Building Act provided that if a town plan or a ratified local master plan designated land for a purpose other than private construction and the landowner was thereby prevented from using the land in a manner generating a reasonable return , the municipality concerned or , if the land was designated in the plan as being required for ORG needs , the ORG , was obliged to expropriate the land . LAW ) specified that the duty of the municipality or the ORG to expropriate the land took effect only after the landowner ’s application for an exemption from the restriction had been refused and the decision had become effective .
Section CARDINAL ) allowed the landowner to demand expropriation if the municipality or ORG failed to comply with its obligation voluntarily .
